pullRequest.body:
Co-authored by: @jjaassoonn 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [540dc9afe2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20991/commits/540dc9afe24676a2b94138d13c1d46c7423970f9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Central.TensorProduct` (new file)|1579|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft_map_center_le`
`+ Algebra.TensorProduct.includeRight_mep_center_le`
`+ instance : IsCentral K Dᵐᵒᵖ`
`+ left_of_tensor`
`+ left_of_tensor'`
`+ of_algEquiv`
`+ right_of_tensor`
`+ right_of_tensor'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Looks like #20721 is useful for these too ...
care to elaborate a little bit?

See [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2320721.20.60Equiv.60s.20involving.20.60center.60.20and.20.60Module.2EEnd.60/near/495558986) for a description of the PR. Not sure how much it shortens your proofs though.
I think this would be better stated as injectivity of `(fun m : M ↦ m ⊗ₜ[R] n)`
you mean like `Function.Injective <| Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft`?

[Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft_injective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Flat/Basic.html#Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft_injective) already exists and hopefully golfs this proof a bit.

Yes [Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft_injective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Flat/Basic.html#Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft_injective) solves it! :)) Deleted this lemma
Is `SMulRegular R a` sufficient here, instead of `NoZeroSMulDivisors`?
Are you talking about `IsSMulRegular`? I tried and I don't think it worked... :((

```suggestion
  have ee : Subalgebra.center K B ≃ₐ[K] K := e.symm.trans e2
```

I think this lemma would be appropriate generality for mathlib (from Lorenz's Algebra, Volume II). I wonder what reference has you been using for Brauer groups?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a809ebc2-dc10-49bf-883c-959a8bfd8121)
We have this result and we're going to PR it after #18764 :))
Indeed the PR looks quite close. It seems all you need are `(A' ⊗ K) ⊔ (K ⊗ B') = A' ⊗ B'` and `(A' ⊗ B) ⊓ (A ⊗ B') = A' ⊗ B'` to deduce F12.
Yes we will PR about them after #18764 is merge :)

```suggestion
  out z hz := by
```
`(Subalgebra.center K B).map (Algebra.TensorProduct.includeLeft)` might be a better spelling compared to `LinearMap.range` (@alreadydone told me this in a previous PR)
Why give `[hbc : Algebra.IsCentral K (B ⊗[K] C)]` a name?
deleted

```suggestion
lemma of_algEquiv (e : D ≃ₐ[K] D') : IsCentral K D' where
```
since this is a `lemma`.
What is `h` here, and why do you need to name it / is it not already named?
deleted!
Is the converse statement true as well?
yes the converse is true I'm going to PR it in the next PR

Are you going to PR [this](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20991#discussion_r1927535189) first? I think this PR should depend on that statement? (If Z(B) has dimension >1 over K then Z(B ⊗ C) = Z(B) ⊗ Z(C) also has dimension >1.)

An easier proof would be the following: If A' is a K-subalgebra of A and B' is a K-subalgebra of B such that `K → A' ⊗ B'` is surjective, and if we assume that B is flat over K, then `A' → A' ⊗ B'` is injective, which implies that `K → A'` is surjective by [Function.Surjective.of_comp_left](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Function/Basic.html#Function.Surjective.of_comp_left) (notice that `A' ⊗ B'` here isn't actually a tensor product, but the image of the tensor product in `A ⊗[K] B`). Now take `A' = Z(A)` and `B' = Z(B)`, then `A' ⊗[K] B'` is contained in `Z(A ⊗[K] B)`, so you can deduce that `K → A' ⊗ B'` is surjective from that `K → Z(A ⊗[K] B)` is surjective again by `Function.Surjective.of_comp_left`. Notice that the containment doesn't require Module.Free; for results in #18764 that require Module.Free, you can also extract one containment that doesn't require the assumption.

Actually, the proof can be much simpler and there's no need of a separate PR on the center of the tensor product; see [my branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/more_on_CSA2...jyxu/more_on_CSA2?expand=1).
Please feel free to merge and add `includeRight_map_center_le` and the Field + Nontrivial versions (where flatness and injectivity are automatic).
merged!

From #18764 I think you can do away with `[CommSemiring K]` (better rename K to R) with [Module.Free R B] [Module.Free R C] (probably you don't need both), `Ring` can be replaced by `Semiring`, and `FiniteDimensional` shouldn't be necessary.
hmmm but `Module.FaithfullyFlat` is defined on `CommRing`?
Please see my [comment above](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20991#discussion_r1930847247).
Please explain the primed names in docstrings

There's no reason A and B have to be in the same universe, right?
Does [RingHom.injective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/SimpleRing/Basic.html#RingHom.injective) need more imports?
```suggestion
lemma left_of_tensor' (K A B : Type*) [Field K] [Ring A] [Ring B] [Nontrivial B]
    [Algebra K A] [Algebra K B] [IsCentral K (A ⊗[K] B)] : IsCentral K A :=
  left_of_tensor K A B <| NoZeroSMulDivisors.algebraMap_injective K B

lemma right_of_tensor' (K A B : Type*) [Field K] [Ring A] [Ring B] [Nontrivial A]
    [Algebra K A] [Algebra K B] [IsCentral K (A ⊗[K] B)] : IsCentral K B :=
  right_of_tensor K A B <| NoZeroSMulDivisors.algebraMap_injective K A
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Mathlib/Algebra/Central/TensorProduct): More on Central Algebras
